definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: A geodesic dome is a round building made of many straight-sided pieces.
sentences.chinese: 测地线拱顶是一个全面建设的许多直幅片面。

sentences.english: That's just your side of the story.
Of course, when engaging in criticism we should present facts, reason things out and guard against being one-sided.
sentences.chinese: 当然，批判的时候要摆事实，讲道理，防止片面性。

sentences.chinese: 因此，仅依据总汞含量来考察汞的毒性是片面的。

sentences.english: Musharraf has unilaterally amended the constitution at the beginning of the week and caused strong objections and noises.
sentences.chinese: 穆夏拉夫本周初片面修改宪法，掀起极大的反弹声浪。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, his empirical research also has certain one-sidedness in data.
sentences.chinese: 同时，他的经验分析在数据上也具有一定的片面性。

sentences.chinese: 我也思考过媒体消极片面报道中国的原因。
